meanings.definition: Relating to the system or process of naming things.
meanings.sent1: The nomenclatorial process of labeling the plants was meticulous.
meanings.sent2: The scientist's nomenclatorial skills were essential in categorizing the new species.
meanings.sent3: The nomenclatorial task of naming the puppies turned into a fun game for the children.
meanings.sent4: Her nomenclatorial precision was like a well-organized library of words.
meanings.sent5: The nomenclatorial approach made the identification of constellations easier.

meanings.sent1: The book contained a nomenclatorial list of all the elements.
meanings.sent2: The museum displayed a nomenclatorial chart of ancient artifacts.
meanings.sent3: The nomenclatorial challenge of memorizing scientific terms was daunting.
meanings.sent4: His nomenclatorial expertise was like a map guiding through the world of words.
meanings.sent5: The nomenclatorial guidebook helped students navigate the complex terminology.

meanings.definition: Pertaining to the act of assigning names.
meanings.sent1: The nomenclatorial task of naming the stars was fascinating.
meanings.sent2: The professor's nomenclatorial approach to classifying organisms was renowned.
meanings.sent3: The nomenclatorial duty of naming the streets brought joy to the committee.
meanings.sent4: Her nomenclatorial talent was like a painter choosing colors for a masterpiece.
meanings.sent5: The nomenclatorial process of labeling historical events made studying easier.
